RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
He took his degree in Management Engineering at the University of Bologna in 2000. At the same University he obtained his PhD in ?Automatic and Operations Research? in 2004, and worked as a post-doc from 2004 to 2006. Since 2006 he has been working at the Department of Sciences and Methods for Engineering (DISMI), University of Modena and Reggio Emilia (UNIMORE), first as assistant professor and then as associate professor.
He is author of about 50 publications in international journals and volumes with referees, among which Operations Research, Mathematical Programming, Discrete Applied Mathematics, INFORMS Journal on Computing, Networks and Transportation Science. He is also associate editor of Pesquisa Operacional.
He is delegate for the international acitvity of the DISMI. He has been responsible of the Science without Borders (SWB) program for UNIMORE. Under the SWB program he has also been special visiting researcher at the Universidade Federal da Paraiba.
His research activity concerns the development of exact and heuristic algorithms for Operations Research and Combinatorial Optimization problems, particularly focusing on vehicle loading and routing, multi-dimensional cutting and packing, and scheduling.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Ingegneria Gestionale from Universitа di Bologna (2000) and doctorate at Automatica e Ricerca Operativa from Universitа di Bologna (2004). Has experience in Production Engineering, focusing on Operational Research

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES:
Since 2010 Manuel Iori has been in the program committe of the conferences ?GECCO", ?Matheuristics", and ?Odysseus".
He has been visiting fellow abroad in the following Universities: Universidade Federal da Paraнba (Brazil), Universidad de Santiago de Chile and Universidad de Concepcion (Chile), Universidade Estadual do Cearа (Brazil), Universitй de Montrйal (Canada), Universidad de La Laguna (Spain), and Imperial College of London (Great Britain).

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Department of Engineering Science and Methods

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SAVEME: System and actions for vehicles and transportation hubs to support disaster mitigation and evacuation
DESERVE: development platform for safe and efficient drive
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: DESERVE aims at designing and developing a Tool Platform for embedded Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) to exploit the benefits of cross-domain software reuse, standardised interfaces, and easy and safety-compliant integration of heterogeneous modules to cope with the expected increase of functions complexity and the impellent need of cost reduction. The DESERVE Platform will provide the environment for ADAS design, development and pre-validation and even pre-certification of software and hardware modules to be integrated in ADAS applications. Safety critical requirements will be considered in the design and systems development making integrated, trusted, interoperable tools and tool-chains available.
InterMech - MO.RE. и il Centro Interdipartimentale per la Ricerca Applicata e i Servizi nel Settore della Meccanica Avanzata e della Motoristica dell'Universitа di Modena e Reggio Emilia.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Dipartimento di Scienze e Metodi dell'Ingegneria

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SUCCESS - Sustainable Urban Consolidation CentrES for conStruction
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Currently freight transport represents 40% of the total transport emission and 32% in urban area. Many initiatives are under development to reduce costs and negative impact of freight and service trip in urban area. Some of them concern supply chain improvements and more specifically Construction Consolidation Centres (CCCs) projects. This project addresses the different requirements for transferability of supply chain optimization concepts as well as CCCs and new ways of working between supply chain stakeholders. The approach is to identify an integrated collaborative approach and business model among construction supply chain actors.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Science without Borders - Special Visiting Researcher. Optimizing freight transportation: Models and Algorithms

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Science without Borders - Special Visiting Researcher. Optimizing freight transportation: Models and Algorithms
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main goal of the Science without Borders program is to promote the consolidation and expansion of science, technology and innovation in Brazil by means of international exchange and mobilit. The activity proposed in this three-year project has a twofold objective. The first one is that of producing new mathematical models and efficient algorithms for the solution of some important optimization problems arising in the field of freight transportation. The second objective is to transfer technology and scientific knowledge to the Operations Research group of the Universidade Federal da Paraнba. The two objectives of the project will be pursued by six months of research permanence of the Professor Manuel Iori (from the University of Modena and Reggio Emilia - UNIMORE, Italy) at the Universidade Federal da Paraнba. Visits from the other young members of his team, including PhD students and post-doc researchers, are also planned, as well as visits of the Brazilian team to the UNIMORE
